title: Wladimir Klitschko sends message to Anthony Joshua ahead of Andy Ruiz rematch
text:
Wladimir Klitschko wants Anthony Joshua to beat Andy Ruiz Jr in his rematch (Getty Images)

Wladimir Klitschko is hoping Anthony Joshua wins his rematch against Andy Ruiz Jr on December 7.

Joshua suffered the first loss of his professional career at Madison Square Garden in June as he was knocked down four times on the way to a seventh-round defeat to Ruiz.

The 29-year-old is now fighting to win back his WBA (Super), IBF, WBO, and IBO heavyweight titles.

And Klitschko, who lost to Joshua in a superb fight at Wembley in 2017, is backing his former rival to beat Ruiz in Saudi Arabia.

‘The heavyweight division right now is mixed up with a lot of names and different characters,’ Klitschko told Seconds Out.

Joshua was beaten in the seventh round by Ruiz in June (Getty Images)

‘I think it’s getting exciting. You looked kind of bored of the same name conquering the division for a decade, so you have different players.

‘I believe this mixed names in the heavyweight division makes it appealing.

‘I am definitely looking forward to the rematch, Andy Ruiz, as a champion, against Anthony Joshua.

‘We know Anthony has lost, as anyone can lose, and now we’re going to watch how he is going to manage this challenge to become champion again.

‘I could think anything but the reality is everyone can lose a fight. But not everyone can recover.

‘It’s the next challenge and I really wish to Anthony that he’s going to make it.

Joshua is aiming to win back four heavyweight titles from Ruiz (AFP/Getty Images)

‘No disrespect to Andy Ruiz, I think he’s done an amazing job.

‘But I’ve always been a fan of Anthony since we fought, we’ve met, since actually I was watching him win an Olympic gold medal.

‘To both the fighters – good luck, let the strongest win. I just really hope Anthony is going to make it.’
